Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel Nice Hotel and clean and comfortable. Breakfast was also good - very expensive in Florence though at the minute so beware.
Reviews.Author: streakycat

Reviews.Content: Basic Hotel We stayed in Malaspina Hotel for 3 nights in late Sept, early Oct,Upon arrival reception staff were courteous, unfortunately this was the only time during our stay that we received as much as a 'Hello'. They seemed at all other times to be totally dis-interested in their customer and their work.Hotel is situated approx 12 mins from central station and within walkiing distance of Duoma, Ponte Vecchio etc. Provided you ignore the reception staff then you will be ok.Breakfast was very poor with little or no selection so you have to take breakfast elsewhere. No fruit, fresh or otherwise.
Reviews.Author: Dublinmale

Reviews.Content: Lots of comforts!       nice bathroom
Reviews.Author: jerseytraveler82

Reviews.Content: Clean, Nice and as advertised       Bathroom
Reviews.Author: mannexmaniac

Reviews.Content: Great Room and Location but Luca Needs to be Fired This is a late review but I think it's important to write it even though several months after the fact. I took my daugher on a 10 day, 3 country trip to Europe in March, our first European trip. We booked the Malaspina thru a Travel Agent in advance for 3 nights. Unfortunately, the reviews we read about Malaspina prior to going were pretty spot on....that the hotel was OK and decently located but the desk staff were very unfriendly. The hotel is located just a short walk from the train station. It's also an easy walk to all the major attractions and shopping in Florence. The market was just blocks away. We never took a cab. The hotel is pretty basic. We did get a comfortable room on the first floor that was directely behind the front desk...it was very spacious and looked out on the park across the street. There was little noise even though we were at street level. Our room came with a breakfast buffet which was just average in comparison....Spain was about the same and France was much, much better in terms of breakfast. The front desk staff at Malaspina turned out to be not very friendly just as others warned via TripAdvisor, and in particular Luca was downright rude and arrogant. He was ok the night we checked in when we asked where we could eat some decent pasta nearby. He said the name of a place but said it was often busy so he would call to check if there was a wait. He spoke in Italian so we had no idea what he was saying, then sent us on our way. When we found the place, the menu was posted but we wanted simpler fare as we were tired from traveling all day. We went to a different place. The next night, Luca very rudely asked me why we didn't go to the restaurant. I told him, and he shot back that he had made a reservation for us. He NEVER told us that and we never asked him to make a reservation for us, we only asked for a recommendation. Apparently he lost his kickback for sending us to the restaurant. After that, he continued to be rude and even went so far as to not assist a visitor/friend who was trying to find us in the hotel. We had even gone out to talk to Luca to tell him we expected a visitor that last night. Yet somehow he could not connect us. This caused a lot of heartache to our visitor and to us. We complained before we checked out to the manager as we felt Luca was retaliating over the restaurant issue. The manager basically said there was no way that Luca would do such a thing and of course Luca lied his butt off. In all of our trip, this was our worst experience with customer service. Every other hotel we stayed in in Europe was extremely helpful and friendly just as we try to be wherever we travel. I will say that the manager at Malaspina at least was helpful in storing our bags that last day...seemingly to make up for Luca. Too bad, one bad employee has to spoil an otherwise pleasant experience. Luca has no business being in a customer service job and management should recognize that.
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel052

Reviews.Content: A Cozy Getaway We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights recently and loved our stay as the room was clean, well decorated and spacious enough for a 3 member family. The 18 century ambience is impressive. The hotel staff was helpful enough to show us the directions to places of attractions and assist for taxi booking. While the location of this hotel is near a park - Independnza (a calm and peaceful location), its not easy to locate and navigate to this hotel from the station as the streets from station to the hotel are narrow, were dug up and crowded. On the brighter side, there is a nice flee market near the hotel that opens everyday from 9.30 am. There is also a small Indian store (Raipura) located in one of the lanes to flee market that sells mineral water, beer (birra) at cheap rates. Overall, an above average experience.
Reviews.Author: kingboca

Reviews.Content: okay My friend booked the hotel based on location to the train station. First of all, it wasn't as close as we wanted it to be considering we had luggage. It is away from all the main attractions so it is quiet. It is hard to find a place to eat in the near area. Decent accommodations. The only bad memory for us is that the front desk person got us confused with another female group and we were meeting a friend who is Italian and he kept telling her we were out when we were waiting in the hotel room for her call. By the time he figured it out, we were too tired to meet up with her. But that is probably a once in a lifetime incident.If I was to visit Florence again, I would probably try to find a hotel a little closer to the train station.
Reviews.Author: travelor96796

Reviews.Content: Perfect location The hotel is just close enough to the main sights like the Galleria and Duomo, but far enough away from the madness of central Firenze. It's also very close to the train station, which was invaluable to us. There aren't many good places to eat in the immediate vicinity but we didn't mind walking a bit. The staff was always friendly and the breakfast was small but decent. There was nothing particularly outstanding about our stay, but we also had no complaints and I think that's more important. I would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: SilverPlane

Reviews.Content: Overall a good experience My friends and I stayed in a triple room in Malaspina and were satisfied with the accommodations. The people working at the front desk were perfectly polite (although not exuberantly friendly). Our room was clean, and the towels were surprisingly nice and thick. The water pressure in the shower was also very good. Our biggest complaint about the room was that it was a bit stuffy, and the AC didn't seem to work that well. Breakfast was also satisfactory. However, the coffee was pretty awful---but I read that one reviewer had excellent espresso during their stay there. We actually did not see or even know that they were serving espresso...so it might be worth asking them about it.
Reviews.Author: traveler0022

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, Good Location This hotel is in a wonderful location. It is close enough to walk to from the train terminal (unless you have a ton of luggage). Florence is a pretty easy city to get around and we had no problem at all walking to all of the sights around town. It was only a 5 minute walk to the Accademia Museum. The hotel room was nice but nothing elaborate. There was kind of a funny smell in the air but once we opened the window it went away. The bathroom is small but perfectly acceptable. Room was clean which is what's most important.The breakfast is good but minimal. You can get a drink there but there is not really a bar so to speak. There is one girl on the staff that was very helpful to us but the rest of the staff that we spoke with were not especially friendly or helpful. The one thing that really upset me about this hotel is that we did some laundry while we were there and they charged us a ridiculous amount for it. It was certainly less than a full load of laundry and they charged us over 99 Euros for it! I complained and asked for a manager but there was nobody in at the time. Apparently they had prices on the 2nd sheet of the laundry form but no prices on the first page. I felt like it was trickery and told them so. I expected it to be expensive to do laundry at a hotel but I found this charge to be way out of line. The guy at the desk at the time didn't really care that I was upset either. Overall, there was nothing wrong w/ the hotel itself and the location was great. Just beware of anything that you have to pay for and ask ahead of time what the charge is.
Reviews.Author: bengalcatlover

Reviews.Content: Good location, physically fine, service a bit unfriendly but decent Much has already been said by other reviewers, here are some specific points:- excellent location if you are attending an event at the Fortezza da Basso (conference center). However it is a bit farther away from some of the main Firenze attractions than many of the other hotels (which is a plus in my mind, you're out of the 'storm')- our room was on the via Nazionale side which has car/truck noise 24x7 if the window is open (none when window closed, but then the room was a bit stuffy). Possibly the rooms on the Piazza Indipendenza are quieter, it's worth asking (and also you'll have more of a view, with trees)- the hotel is only a five minute walk from the train station if you walk very fast, not possible if you are lugging bags. Closer to 10-15 minutes especially if the sidewalk is crowded. Same to the Duomo et al- we liked the unpretentious spaghetteria (there's a nice garden-ish room in the back) right down the block on the via Nazionale as well as the little cafe across the piazza from the hotel (corner of Nazionale)- 2 out of the 4 front desk staff we interacted with were not friendly, although one seemed to warm up after the first couple of days. One was on the phone (not with customers, seemingly) almost constantly. The others were fine.- the towels were indeed great, fluffy, large- our room (a triple) was fine, nothing amazing but good for a 3-star- the breakfast was also fine, better than some, worse than others. On the first morning no one came by to offer espresso/capuccino so we didn't know it was available, and the other coffee is not good. However the second and third morning we were asked and the espresso was quite good.
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyNY

Reviews.Content: Great Stayed here for 3 days in October. The rooms were spotlessly clean as were the bathrooms.Beds were very comfortable. Our room had two sets of double glazing ensuring a very good night's sleep. The location is perfect for walking anywhere in Florence and very convenient for the railway station, which was how we arrived. The trains in Italy are amazingly cheap!Breakfast was adequate but not a great deal of choice, they even ran out of bread one morning (we were last down!).I thoroughly recommend this place for value for money.
Reviews.Author: BarbaraMills

Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, excellent location My wife, 6 year old daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Mapaspina for two nights in July 07. It is excellently located, no more than a five minute walk to the old city squares in the centre of Florence. It is situated directly in front of a lovely little park which makes a very pleasant place to sit out at the start or end of your days in Florence. The hotel was very clean and the room we stayed in was very spacious - bigger than rooms in hotels we've stayed in for three times the price. By the way, do not book direclty with the hotel. We used an online agency and it was less than half the price that it would have cost direct with the hotel.Breakfast was included in the price and was a very well laid out buffet style with pastries, cereal, yogurts, eggs, fruit, etc. There is no restaurant there, but with so many only a few minutes walk away, it's not an issue. There is a lovely small bar on the ground floor though. Parking is dealt with by the hotel - you drop the car off, they park it for you and when you want it again you have it within ten minutes. Be aware however that the parking is not cheap in Florence. It cost us 鈧?5 per day. Overall, cannot fault the hotel. Friendly staff, great location, great price, very quiet and relaxed. We would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in Florence.
Reviews.Author: cfkire

Reviews.Content: not our favorite hotel Okay, that's probably an understatement. We expected much more, especially since we were on our honeymoon. The hotel was only a couple blocks from a train station, and there was a cute park in front, but these were the only good points whatsoever. The staff is not friendly and was not helpful at all. Anytime we asked a question it was like we were putting them out of their way. The breakfast was just okay; but the worst of our four destinations. The staff entered our room severals times a day, even if we had the Do Not Disturb sign up. We did not feel like guests. Our room was large, but empty and very plain. The bathroom looked nice, however the lights were broken and their were sewer fumes coming into the room. When we mentioned this to the front desk, their response was to just keep the door closed. We were not impressed with Florence in general. We heard many similar complaints from other tourists we met. If you're not into art, the only good thing about Florence is Piazza Michelangelo where you can see the beautiful skyline of Florence. We tried to get out of Florence, but the trains were on strike so we were trapped. We recommend staying in the countryside of Tuscany and taking a day trip or two to Florence. We didn't encounter these problems anywhere else we went in Italy.
Reviews.Author: duka24

Reviews.Content: An ideal place to stay in Florence       Front of Hotel Malaspina
Reviews.Author: lara_maesteg

Reviews.Content: Just OK       view from top floor of hotel
Reviews.Author: jcavfish

Reviews.Content: Didnt live up to reviews Thankfully we only had booked this hotel for one night -- had we planned to stay longer it would have been a huge nightmare. The experience began with rude front desk staff that seemed annoyed that our Italian was not perfect. When we got to the room we found used towels in the bathroom and waited almost two hours before fresh ones arrived. The bathroom must have not been cleaned as the sink basin had shaving residue and the toilet seat was up when we arrived in the room. There was considerable street noise throughout the night that added to the bad experience. Top it off with a cold shower in the morning and we were more than ready to move on in our travels!
Reviews.Author: dctravelWashington

Reviews.Content: Great stay I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in this very homely hotel. Excellent location, about 5 minutes walk from San Marco and 10 from the Duomo. Staff were friendly and very helpful. The single room was small, but cosy, and the whole place was tastefully decorated and immaculately clean. It seemed like the place had been recently renovated. Good choice of food at breakfast. I would make a point of staying here again.
Reviews.Author: GlenCross

Reviews.Content: Top place We're back from a four night stay, cut to three nights due to the awful Meridiana cancelling our 8pm flight and bussing us from Gatwich to a hotel in Croydon between 3-6am before bussing us back for the morning flight... a long story but we were exhausted and grumpy; the hotel had cancelled our booking as we hadn't turned up and we'd forgotten to call them (oops) but they were gracious and couldn't have been more helpful. They only charged us for the 3 nights we did stay.Our rooms were large, exceptionally clean, quiet (considering their position overlooking a noisy square, but the double glazing was good). One room included a long balcony overlooking the square with the national flag flying from it - wonderful. They weren't luxurious but were perfect for our needs. The bed was very comfortable, there were more than enough clean towels and plentiful hot water, the mini bar was well enough stocked, and there was plenty of storage.Breakfast was a little dull but ok. The reception rooms are lovely, and I enjoyed sitting and waiting for friends there. Best of all, it's close into the city and an easy walk to everywhere.A charming woman on reception booked all our museum tickets willingly and helped juggle the timings for us. Our trip changed from ghastly (flight) to wonderful.As well as that, everyone we met in Florence (except a grumpy Brit - I'm talking locals) was at least friendly and sometimes genuinely interested to chat - more that I could say for many destinations including my home city. We felt welcome and had an excellent time.
Reviews.Author: Candyjo

Reviews.Content: Decent hotel in good area Hotel Malaspina looks much better in the pictures than it really is. The accomodations are fair and could be cleaner. The hotel is centrally located, and the breakfast was the best my boyfriend and I experienced in the three hotels we visited during our trip to Venice, Florence, and Rome. Service was good but nothing out of the ordinary.
Reviews.Author: pnkyswr

Reviews.Content: Nice Location We have stayed here before and decided to come back. The rooms are clean. The staff is very friendly except for one cranky guy. The hotel is near the bus / train terminal , airport, and shopping. Also, breakfasts are included with the rooms.
Reviews.Author: Chi-towngurl

Reviews.Content: Good location We stayed at the Malaspina for a total of five nights. The hotel is located within walking distance from the train station and to the museums, duomo and other significant sights in Florence. We love to walk and although another reviewer preferred a more central location, to us this was perfect. The hotel location at the piazza also gave us some perspective of what the local people did at the piazzas especially in the early evening. After three nights we had to go to another city. We requested to be placed in the same room when we came back for two more nights and the front desk staff was gracious enough to arrange it. Although some were not as talkative, they were always gracious when spoken to. We had to borrow a wine bottle opener and were also given real glasses to use. (We had wine and cheese for a late night snack.) The room was clean, bed comfortable and the tiled bathroom was spotless. As for breakfast, they offered sufficient variety to choose from. Although fresh fruit would have been nice, there's nothing wrong with the canned big chunks of fruit. Their breakfast beats continental breakfast anytime. Will I go back to Malaspina for the second time? Definitely.
Reviews.Author: sainted

Reviews.Content: Old World Charm Just spent 5 nights here on a family vacation with my mother, sister and neice and was not disappointed. Great value for the money. This hotel has a lovely, old-world feel . There are antiques in the common areas and hallways. The room I shared with my neice was also quite comfortable. Good beds. Excellent air conditioning. A bidet and plenty of large fluffy towels. The breakfast buffet was also ample with something for everyone, and a team of gracious servers brought you your cofee. Cappucino was available. The only thing that seemed out of place was the canned fruit. Yuck! I liked the location, on the end of the Piazza Independenza. The hotel was easy to find and within walking distance of everything. Some really good restaurants in the area too. The piazza (to quote another reviewer) is quite bland, but they did have a large outdoor TV screen where we could watch World Cup soccer al fresco. What a thrill to be there with the locals when Italy beat Germany!I also have to say a few words about the cold, disinterested front desk staff. They seemed put-upon and aloof. One disturbing note was a fire alarm one evening as we were getting ready for dinner. Nobody seemed to know what was going on, if it was real or a false alarm. No fire engines or police came and the front desk staff seemed to have no interest in getting the guests out of the hotel, nor were they able to tell us what was going on. Had they even been trained about what to do in the event of an emergency? . Fortunately, it turned out to be minor. One of the maintenence staff burned some toast down in the dining room when he was preparing his tea. But it gave me a chill to think about what might have occured if this were a real emergency.
Reviews.Author: voicegirl1

Reviews.Content: Bad Spine is actually quite comfy! The name of the hotel means bad spine in Italian. However, the beds were comfy (better than our Paris and Rome hotels). It's a small hotel, good location from the city center. The towels were the fluffiest ever. The shower was hand-held with old-fashion claw tub. People were friendly (of course handing over your room key and passport is something Americans have to get used to. I would definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: mzandi

Reviews.Content: Adequate for our needs ....October 7-9, 2004 We spent three nights here while visiting Florence. Our travel agent recommended the hotel. It turned out to be adequate for our purposes. We arrived by train from Rome. We were under the impression that the hotel was within walking distance from the train station. We did walk but we should have taken a cab as it was a bit too far. Upon check in the front desk clerk was most welcoming. Our rooms were small and the bathrooms even smaller, with even smaller showers. Everything was in working order, but the shower area was difficult to keep clean and this showed. This hotel is in a charming old mansion located about a 10 minute walk from the main attractions in Florence. The museum housing the original David is very close by as is the market place. The hotel sits in a more residential area of the city on the lovely Piazza Indipendenza. We did not find the hotel's location an inconvenience. Breakfast was the same thing everyday including canned (rather than fresh fruit). It's served in the lower level of the hotel which is rather institutional in nature. This hotel has so much potential if the owners would apply some creativity. In the meantime is was adequate for our needs.
Reviews.Author: hlg123

Reviews.Content: Perfect for the business traveller, otherwise lacking charm   showReview(2571666, 'full');
Reviews.Author: DianeBee

Reviews.Content: best hotel where I have stayed in Europe   showReview(2499576, 'full');
